VariableDescription.Name: OrbitNumber
VariableDescription.Header:
# ******************************************************* 
#  WARNING: Increase time period selected for listing. 
# ******************************************************* 
# 
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           DE-2 UA 16-sec combined neutral and plasma unified abstract data
#     PROJECT                         DE>Dynamics Explorer
#     SOURCE_NAME                     DE>Dynamics Explorer
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric  Ionospheric Interactions
#     DESCRIPTOR                      UA16S> Unified abstract 16 second
#     DATA_TYPE                       ALL> all instruments combined
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            This data set was generated at NSSDC from the DE-2 Unified Abstract (UA) data                          
#     TEXT                             and the DE-2 orbit/attitude data base and software. The daily UA files contain                        
#     TEXT                             16 second averages from the NACS, WATS, LANG, FPI and RPA/IDM instruments for                         
#     TEXT                             the whole DE-2 mission period.  The PI-provided data in VAX/VMS binary format                         
#     TEXT                             were converted to ASCII format and the most important orbit parameters were                           
#     TEXT                             added using the a/o data base and software provided by the DE project team.                           
#     TEXT                             Subsetting, plotting, and downloading (in ASCII format) capabilities for these                        
#     TEXT                             data are provided through the ATMOWeb interface at http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/atmoweb/The             
#     TEXT                             ASCII are are also available from NSSDC anonymous ftp archive at ftp://nssdcftp.gsfc.nasa.gov/spacecra
#     TEXT                             Each UA record contains the following data: N2, O, He, Ar, and N densities                            
#     TEXT                             [cm-3] from the Neutral Atmosphere Composition Spectrometer (NACS), neutral                           
#     TEXT                             temperature [K], eastward and upward neutral wind [m/s] from the Wind and Temperature                 
#     TEXT                             Spectrometer (WATS), plasma density [cm-3] and electron temperature [K] from                          
#     TEXT                             the Langmuir Probe experiment (LANG), wavelength [A], tangent altitude [km],                          
#     TEXT                             northward neutral wind [m/s], neutral temperature [K], and intensity [Raleighs],                      
#     TEXT                             from the Fabry Interferometer (FPI), ion temperature [K], total ion density                           
#     TEXT                             [cm-3], eastward, northward, and upward ion drift [m/s] from the Retarding                            
#     TEXT                             Potential Analyzer/Ion Drift Meter (RPA/IDM). The IDM data entry is the revised                       
#     TEXT                             version of June 1994. Also included are the latitude, longitude, altitude,                            
#     TEXT                             local time and other orbit parameters. Higher time resolution data are available                      
#                                      from NSSDC for the individual experiments at ftp://nssdcftp.gsfc.nasa.gov/spacecraft_data/de/de2/     
#                                     This investigation used data from several spacecraft instruments to study the                          
#                                      large-scale neutral-plasma interactions in the thermosphere caused by magnetospheric-ionospheric      
#                                      and thermospheric coupling processes. Planned use of the models is to provide                         
#                                      a theoretical framework in which certain important ionospheric and atmospheric                        
#                                      properties needed for coupling processes (such as the Pedersen and Hall conductivities)               
#                                      were consistently calculated using satellite data measured at a given height.                         
#                                      Planned examples are (1) to calculate vertical profiles of ionospheric properties                     
#                                      that were useful for comparison with incoherent scatter radar measurements                            
#                                      and other ground-based supporting data, (2) to identify and evaluate the neutral                      
#                                      thermospheric heat and momentum sources, and (3) to determine the effectiveness                       
#                                      of high-latitude dynamic processes in controlling the global thermospheric                            
#                                      circulation and thermal structure.                                                                    
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0241
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  de2_ua16s_all
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 de2_ua16s_all_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      16-sec combined neutral  and plasma unified abstract (UA) data
#     PI_NAME                         Mr. Larry H. Brace
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NASA/GSFC
#     NSSDC_ID                        SPIO-00137
#     MISSION_GROUP                   DE
#                                     !___Magnetospheric Data
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Particles (space)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:15:46 2015

VariableDescription.Header:
# ******************************************************* 
#  WARNING: Increase time period selected for listing. 
# ******************************************************* 
# 
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           DE-2 UA 16-sec combined neutral and plasma unified abstract data
#     PROJECT                         DE>Dynamics Explorer
#     SOURCE_NAME                     DE>Dynamics Explorer
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric  Ionospheric Interactions
#     DESCRIPTOR                      UA16S> Unified abstract 16 second
#     DATA_TYPE                       ALL> all instruments combined
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TEXT                            This data set was generated at NSSDC from the DE-2 Unified Abstract (UA) data                          
#     TEXT                             and the DE-2 orbit/attitude data base and software. The daily UA files contain                        
#     TEXT                             16 second averages from the NACS, WATS, LANG, FPI and RPA/IDM instruments for                         
#     TEXT                             the whole DE-2 mission period.  The PI-provided data in VAX/VMS binary format                         
#     TEXT                             were converted to ASCII format and the most important orbit parameters were                           
#     TEXT                             added using the a/o data base and software provided by the DE project team.                           
#     TEXT                             Subsetting, plotting, and downloading (in ASCII format) capabilities for these                        
#     TEXT                             data are provided through the ATMOWeb interface at http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/atmoweb/The             
#     TEXT                             ASCII are are also available from NSSDC anonymous ftp archive at ftp://nssdcftp.gsfc.nasa.gov/spacecra
#     TEXT                             Each UA record contains the following data: N2, O, He, Ar, and N densities                            
#     TEXT                             [cm-3] from the Neutral Atmosphere Composition Spectrometer (NACS), neutral                           
#     TEXT                             temperature [K], eastward and upward neutral wind [m/s] from the Wind and Temperature                 
#     TEXT                             Spectrometer (WATS), plasma density [cm-3] and electron temperature [K] from                          
#     TEXT                             the Langmuir Probe experiment (LANG), wavelength [A], tangent altitude [km],                          
#     TEXT                             northward neutral wind [m/s], neutral temperature [K], and intensity [Raleighs],                      
#     TEXT                             from the Fabry Interferometer (FPI), ion temperature [K], total ion density                           
#     TEXT                             [cm-3], eastward, northward, and upward ion drift [m/s] from the Retarding                            
#     TEXT                             Potential Analyzer/Ion Drift Meter (RPA/IDM). The IDM data entry is the revised                       
#     TEXT                             version of June 1994. Also included are the latitude, longitude, altitude,                            
#     TEXT                             local time and other orbit parameters. Higher time resolution data are available                      
#                                      from NSSDC for the individual experiments at ftp://nssdcftp.gsfc.nasa.gov/spacecraft_data/de/de2/     
#                                     This investigation used data from several spacecraft instruments to study the                          
#                                      large-scale neutral-plasma interactions in the thermosphere caused by magnetospheric-ionospheric      
#                                      and thermospheric coupling processes. Planned use of the models is to provide                         
#                                      a theoretical framework in which certain important ionospheric and atmospheric                        
#                                      properties needed for coupling processes (such as the Pedersen and Hall conductivities)               
#                                      were consistently calculated using satellite data measured at a given height.                         
#                                      Planned examples are (1) to calculate vertical profiles of ionospheric properties                     
#                                      that were useful for comparison with incoherent scatter radar measurements                            
#                                      and other ground-based supporting data, (2) to identify and evaluate the neutral                      
#                                      thermospheric heat and momentum sources, and (3) to determine the effectiveness                       
#                                      of high-latitude dynamic processes in controlling the global thermospheric                            
#                                      circulation and thermal structure.                                                                    
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0241
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  de2_ua16s_all
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 de2_ua16s_all_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      16-sec combined neutral  and plasma unified abstract (UA) data
#     PI_NAME                         Mr. Larry H. Brace

#     TEXT                             temperature [K], eastward and upward neutral wind [m/s] from the Wind and Temperature                 
#     TEXT                             Spectrometer (WATS), plasma density [cm-3] and electron temperature [K] from                          
#     TEXT                             the Langmuir Probe experiment (LANG), wavelength [A], tangent altitude [km],
